1.title: The Obama Administration Excuses Child-Rape in Afghanistan as 'Their Culture'
1.plot: Ben Carson answers a stupid question stupidly. Afghan police officers rape boys, and Marines are told to look the other way.

2.title: Shout Your Abortion
2.plot: Senate Democrats block an abortion bill. The hashtag #ShoutYourAbortion trends on Twitter and Facebook. Ben calls Pope Benedict "a disaster area".

3.title: Cruz in the Crosshairs
3.plot: Republicans would rather bash Ted Cruz than defund Planned Parenthood.

4.title: Russia in Syria
4.plot: Erica Maison gives her 14-year-old son a dose of estrogen. Vladimir Putin exploits the weakness of President Obama.

5.title: Rubio's PC Problem
5.plot: Obama uses the Umpqua Community College shooting to demonize his political opposition. Marco Rubio is too politically correct.

6.title: McCarthy Out, Republicans Ready to Surrender?
6.plot: Amber Rose holds a slut walk in Los Angeles. Kevin McCarthy of California drops out of the race for Speaker of the House.

7.title: Guns, Jews and Dr. Ben Carson
7.plot: The Left is outraged when Ben Carson says that Jews could have used guns during the Holocaust. Palestinians randomly stab Jews in Israel. Ben argues that it's the Democrats, not the Republicans, who are the extremists.

8.title: David Brooks Hates Conservatives
8.plot: Individualism works and collectivism doesn't, says Ben. Russians shoot down a Malaysian airliner. Ben finds David Brooks of the New York Times to be less conservative than advertised.

9.title: Grading the Democrats
9.plot: Ben gives a letter grade to each of the Democrats in their first presidential debate: Hillary Clinton, Bernie Sanders, Jim Webb, Lincoln Chafee and Martin O'Malley.

10.title: The Left Destroys Comic Books and also Everything
10.plot: Ben takes a dim view of new comic books featuring Captain America, Superman and Batman. Joe Biden decides whether to run for president. Donald Trump attacks Jeb Bush.

11.title: What If Luke Skywalker Is Evil?
11.plot: Planned Parenthood tweets about cisgender men. Ben has a theory about the upcoming Star Wars movie. "Beasts of No Nation" has a telling moment.

12.title: Selena Gomez Would Have Been Slutty Ten Years Ago
12.plot: Paul Ryan puts conditions on his becoming a Speaker of the House. An ABC News-Washington Post poll has Donald Trump up to 32%. Ben revives his "Deconstructing the Culture" segment from his Seattle show.

13.title: The Benghazi Hearing
13.plot: Hillary Clinton casts aspersions on the late ambassador to Libya, J. Christopher Stevens. Joe Biden gives an incoherent speech.

14.title: Don't Kill Baby Hitler
14.plot: Ben recommends against killing baby Hitler. Elijah Cummings defends Hillary Clinton. Ben Carson outpaces Donald Trump in the polls.

15.title: Paul Ryan and the Future of Congress
15.plot: Lena Dunham dresses as a Planned Parenthood doctor for Halloween. A cop in a South Carolina high school uses excessive force on a girl. Paul Ryan is set to become Speaker of the House.

364.title: The Left Defends Evil of Its Own
364.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

365.title: Real Terror, Fake News
365.plot: Terrorists attack in Barcelona, but the Left continues to talk about the statues in Charlottesville. Ben's old boss, Steve Bannon, is ousted from the Trump administration.

366.title: Everyone's a Nazi Now
366.plot: The media misrepresents the Boston free speech rally. Ben collects his thoughts re Steve Bannon's ouster from the White House. Jerry Lewis dies. Jerry Falwell Jr. makes a dumb remark.

367.title: Commander-In-Chief Trump Tackles Afghanistan
367.plot: Trump changes his mind on Afghanistan. Ben is more impressed with cochlear implants than the solar eclipse.

368.title: Like a Phoenix from the Ashes
368.plot: ESPN frets over a football announcer named Robert Lee. Trump, in Phoenix, rants about the media. Ben recommends a Bette Davis movie. Trevor Noah believes the U.S. is now the Third Reich.

369.title: How the Left Blows Itself Up, in 4 Easy Steps
369.plot: Gaffe-prone Donald Trump is more than a match for the self-immolating Left.

370.title: The War on Children
370.plot: The Left loves your children more than you. A high school coach is forbidden from praying on the fifty-yard line. Ben recommends "The Miracle Worker" (1962)

371.title: Trump's First Crisis
371.plot: Hurricane Harvey devastates Houston. Antifa returns to Berkeley. The VMAs attack Trump. Ben recommends Will Durant's "The Story of Philosophy".

372.title: Everything Is Political, Including Hurricanes
372.plot: Joel Osteen is accused of barring Hurricane Harvey victims from his Lakewood Church. The Left blames the hurricane on global warming. Two obnoxious celebrities fight.

373.title: Does Trump Have an Empathy Problem?
373.plot: Melania Trump's high heels and Donald Trump's empathy are the issues of the day. The 18th-century philosopher Edmund Burke receives a plug. Ben defends a CNN reporter and praises Nancy Pelosi.

374.title: The Scorn for the Heartland
374.plot: Politico and Charlie Hebdo get heat for their cartoons about Hurricane Harvey. Hollywood prepares an all-female "Lord of the Flies". Ben recommends Stephen West's podcast, "Philosophize This".

375.title: The Democrats' Last, Best Hope
375.plot: Politico reveals how Antifa was treated under Obama. The Left has new hope in the Trump-Russia story. Ben recommends Machiavelli's "The Prince".

376.title: Trump Dumps Obama's Executive Amnesty
376.plot: Ben discusses the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA), a book by Nassim Nicholas Taleb, Trump's response to Hillary's book, and an eight-year-old drag queen.

377.title: Circular Firing Squad
377.plot: Donald Trump wants Congress to make DACA (Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals) permanent, argues Ben. The United States Holocaust Memorial Museum absolves Obama of Syria.

378.title: Trump's Big Democratic Day
378.plot: Donald Trump is "Democrat for a Day". Chuck Schumer sticks with Bob Menendez. Joy Behar seems to think that Mike Huckabee still has authority over his grown daughter.

379.title: When Politics Becomes Religion
379.plot: Dianne Feinstein bludgeons Amy Coney Barrett with the latter's Catholicism. Donald Trump goes full Democrat on DACA and the debt ceiling. Ben recommends showing your children old movies.

380.title: The Berkeley Hurricane
380.plot: The University of California, Berkeley, "braces" for the arrival of Ben as if he were a hurricane. Ben reminds us of a few lessons of September 11, 2001. Hillary Clinton talks with Jane Pauley about her new book.

381.title: Will Trump's Turn to the Center Last?
381.plot: Donald Trump surrenders to Democrats. Hillary Clinton adds to her growing list of those responsible for her defeat. Democrats revive the idea of Medicare for all. Ben calls "Pinocchio" (1940) the greatest of all Disney films.

382.title: Hillary's Big Blame Game
382.plot: Hillary Clinton refuses to leave. The Democrats continue to make tactical blunders. Ben recommends "Bambi' (1942). Technology gives us the ability to become talking poop.

383.title: Did Trump Just Give Away the Border?
383.plot: Donald Trump cuts a deal with Chuck Schumer and Nancy Pelosi on DACA, and onetime supporters like Ann Coulter are not happy. Ben shows video of the security measures being taken in anticipation of his speech at UC of Berkeley.

384.title: The End of the Berkeley Blockade
384.plot: Ben talks about his speech at UC of Berkeley. A new terror attack takes place in London. Chelsea Manning's Harvard visiting fellowship is revoked. Ben recommends "Cinderella" (1950).

385.title: The Culture Wars
385.plot: Donald Trump governs like a moderate Democrat. The Emmys get terrible ratings because the public hates Hollywood. Ben recommends Daphne Du Maurier's novel "Rebecca" and its movie adaptation.

386.title: Was Trump Right About Wiretapping?
386.plot: Donald Trump gives a well-received speech to the UN. Trump's wiretapping tweets may not have been vindicated. Hillary Clinton questions the legitimacy of the election. Ben recommends "Wuthering Heights" (1939)

387.title: Should Jimmy Kimmel Be Appointed King of Health Care?
387.plot: Ben discusses the Graham-Cassidy bill, Donald Trump's foreign policy speech at the UN, "Jane Eyre" (2011), Tucker Carlson's interview with a witch, Rosh Hashanah, and more.

388.title: Trump vs. the NFL
388.plot: Donald Trump clashes with the NFL, and that's bad for the country, says Ben. Trump threatens North Korea via Twitter. Ben Shapiro recommends Edward Feser's new book, " Five Proofs of the Existence of God".

389.title: Episode #1.389
389.plot: Donald Trump goads the Left into going "full Kaepernick" re the kneeling craze among the NFL football players. Ben likes Peter Thiel's new book, hates Darren Aronofsky's new movie.

390.title: That Giant Republican Sucking Sound
390.plot: Democrats and Leftists continue to kneel. The media says Puerto Rico is Donald Trump's Katrina. Ben recommends "After Virtue: A Study in Moral Theory" by Alasdair MacIntyre.

391.title: On to Tax Cuts!
391.plot: Hugh Hefner is dead at 91. The Left, including Michelle Obama and Spike Lee, overreaches. Ben recommends "Saints and Soldiers" (2003). He hates the stage musical, "The Book of Mormon".

392.title: Trump Wins Big on the NFL
392.plot: Donald Trump may have won a political battle by bashing the NFL, says Ben; but in doing so, Trump further polarizes the country. Ben recommends the 1971 TV movie "Brian's Song".

393.title: Evil in Vegas
393.plot: Ben discusses the previous night's mass shooting in Las Vegas and the continuing controversy re Donald Trump's handling of the Puerto Rico disaster.

394.title: The Jimmy Kimmel Gun Grab
394.plot: Jimmy Kimmel makes an emotional appeal for gun control; Ben responds with the cold facts.

395.title: The Moral Preening Never Ends
395.plot: Jimmy Kimmel and Hillary Clinton preen themselves. Donald Trump throws paper towels at Puerto Ricans. TSA learns that Ben is reading "War and Peace".

396.title: The Great Hollywood Collapse
396.plot: Jane Coaston attacks Ben Shapiro in the New York Times. Jimmy Kimmel denies that he's a moral arbiter. Ben illustrates his points about the Harvey Weinstein scandal with scenes from "All About Eve" (1950).

397.title: The Best Pro-Abortion Argument EVER, Debunked
397.plot: Ben Shapiro refutes the abortion argument of Twitter user, Patrick S. Tomlinson. Jane Fonda says she is not proud of America.

398.title: Culture Wars Matter, Political Wars Don't
398.plot: The news is all about Donald Trump and the families of fallen soldiers, while Ben is all about Chris Farley and "Tommy Boy" (1995)

399.title: Are Trump's Wounds Self-Inflicted, or Are They the Media's Fault?
399.plot: Charles Blow writes a bad op-ed in the New York Times about how Donald Trump isn't Hitler, except he's kind of like Hitler. Florida congresswoman Frederica Wilson believes that Niger is Trump's Benghazi.

400.title: Episode #1.400
400.plot: General John Kelly holds a press conference re the controversy of Trump's phone calls to gold-star families. Ben has a more sympathetic view of George W. Bush's recent speech than most other conservatives.

401.title: Why Our Country Is in Serious Trouble
401.plot: Donald Trump's phone call to a gold star widow has become a partisan issue. Bill O'Reilly may have paid $32 million to settle a sex harassment suit.

402.title: White Girls Must Stop Dressing Like Moana
402.plot: Cosmopolitan warns white parents not to let their little girls dress up as Moana. Donald Trump wars with Bob Corker. Greg Tomlin mocks CNN's apple/banana ad.

403.title: Clintonian Lies and a Republican Flake Out
403.plot: Thanks to a new Washington Post report, the Trump dossier is back in the news. Jeff Flake (R) of Arizona resigns from the Senate.

404.title: Is Everything Sexual Assault Now?
404.plot: George H.W. Bush gropes at least two actresses, and it may be the result of dementia. A 17-year-old illegal immigrant successfully sues to be allowed an abortion, and the ACLU celebrates it.

405.title: The Media Sexual Harassment Scandal
405.plot: Mark Halperin joins the long list of alleged sex abusers in the media and Hollywood. Ben recommends Walt Disney's "Sleeping Beauty" (1959). Mailbag topics include Milton Friedman, kosher Skittles, and more.

406.title: It's Indictment Day!
406.plot: Ben discusses former campaign staffer George Papadopoulos, accused molester Kevin Spacey, Down's Syndrome sufferer Frank Stephens, the Federalist Papers No. 1, and more.

407.title: Happy Halloween!
407.plot: Ben is Keith Olbermann for Halloween. The Latino Victory Caucus releases a political ad that makes the infamous Daisy ad against Barry Goldwater look subtle.

408.title: Islamist Terror Hits New York -- Again
408.plot: A terror attack in New York kills eight. Ben warns against politicizing tragedies in the immediate aftermath. A poll reveals that Americans hate political correctness.

409.title: How Hillary and Obama Wrecked the Democratic Party
409.plot: Donna Brazile's book slams Hillary Clinton, Barack Obama and the DNC. Bernie Sanders is now "the center of gravity" in the Democratic Party. Ben approves of the Republican tax plan, even though California residents like him will be screwed.

410.title: It's Bernie's Party
410.plot: The deserter Bowe Bergdahl goes free. Bernie Sanders becomes King of the Democrats. Ben recommends "Battle Hymn of the Tiger Mother" by Amy Chua.

411.title: Another Day, Another Mass Shooting
411.plot: A 26-year-old ex-airman shoots up a Texas church, killing at least two dozen. Ben recommends "Goodbye, Christopher Robin" (2017) and examines The Federalist No. 2.

412.title: A Good Man with a Gun
412.plot: Ben praises the two gunmen responsible for stopping the mass shooter at a Texas church. Don Lemon misunderstands what prayer is for.

413.title: The Democratic Tsunami, or Just Another Ripple?
413.plot: The Democrats "shellac" the Republicans in the various state elections. Ben likes the second season of "Stranger Things" even better than the first one.

414.title: Are We All Members of Cults?
414.plot: Protesters of Trump's election gather and scream at the sky. Lindy West claims that we're ignoring the anger of angry women. Charles Blow declares that it's time for the Left to re-embrace identity politics.

415.title: Should Republicans Dump Moore?
415.plot: Several women accuse Roy Moore, the Republican nominee for the U.S. Senate in Alabama, of sexual assault and other sexual impropriety. The comedian Louis C.K. also becomes the subject of sexual assault allegations. Ben recommends Noah Baumbach's "The Meyerowitz Stories". Hillary Clinton declares that Trump fever has broken. Mailbag topics includes: aliens vs. ghosts; judicial review; Steven Crowder as Ben Shapiro's potential running mate; persuading one's sister to reject the politics of SJWs; the morning-after pill; private-sector unions; the Tower of Babel; and more.

416.title: The Hit on Hannity, and Much Much Moore
416.plot: Democrats demand that Roy Moore step down, remain mum about Bob Menendez. Trump calls Kim Jong-un "short and fat". Ben likes "Thor: Ragnarok".

417.title: Moore Comes Unmoored
417.plot: A new accuser comes out against Roy Moore. CNN thinks it has evidence of collusion between Donald Trump Jr. and Wikileaks. Ben recommends "The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford".

418.title: How Prevalent Is Sexual Harassment?
418.plot: Rep. Jackie Speier reveals that the U.S. House has shelled out 15 million in sex harassment claims. George Takei gets in trouble for his Howard Stern interview.

419.title: Now We Find Out Whether the Democrats Are Full of Crap
419.plot: Leeann Tweeden accuses Sen. Al Franken of sexual assault. Ben gets blowback from the Right for his position on Roy Moore. Ben recommends "Wind River" from writer-director Taylor Sheridan.

420.title: The Garbage Fires to End All Garbage Fires
420.plot: Partisanship dictates who defends Roy Moore and who defends Al Franken and Bob Menendez. Ben recommends "The Lost City of Z" with Charlie Hunnam and Robert Pattinson.

421.title: Warning: Category 5 Tweetstorm
421.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

422.title: Your Taxpayer Bucks Pay for Congress' Sexual Kicks
422.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

423.title: So Many Turkeys, So Little Time
423.plot: Donald Trump finally comments on Roy Moore. Trump is angry over LaVar Ball's ingratitude. Elizabeth Warren accuses Trump of racism for calling her "Pocahontas".

424.title: The Democrats Give Up the Moral High Ground
424.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

425.title: Can You Paint With All the Colors of the Stupid?
425.plot: Donald Trump chooses an awkward moment to jokingly refer to Elizabeth Warren as Pocahontas. James O'Keefe attempts a sting operation against The Washington Post that backfires.

426.title: Lauer's No Longer
426.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

427.title: Trump on the Brink of a Big Win
427.plot: More dirt comes out about Matt Lauer. The Dems finally throw John Conyers under the bus. John McCain announces that he will vote for the tax bill.

428.title: A Grave Injustice in California
428.plot: Mike Flynn pleads guilty to the charge of lying to the FBI. Republicans are set to pass tax reform. Garcia Zarate is found not guilty of murdering Kate Steinle.

429.title: A Scandal About Lying to the FBI About... A Nothingburger?
429.plot: Donald Trump sounds off on the FBI's indictment of Michael Flynn.

430.title: The FBI Screw-Ups: Incompetence or Malice?
430.plot: Republicans relieve their cognitive dissonance re Roy Moore by unreservedly supporting him. Nancy Pelosi declares that the Republican tax bill is Armageddon.

431.title: Trump's Gutsy Jerusalem Call
431.plot: Trump is set to move the U.S. embassy in Tel Aviv to Jerusalem. Al Franken is on his way out. John Conyers' son may be on his way in. Steve Bannon slams Mitt Romney.

432.title: Franken's Frank Is Cooked
432.plot: Al Franken resigns from the senate. The media encourages terrorism after Trump moves the U.S. embassy from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem.

433.title: No Moral High Ground, Just Political High Ground
433.plot: Roy Moore's accuser looks less credible than before. CNN falls on its face. A porn star kills herself in response to online-harassment. Ben answers mailbag questions.

434.title: The Democrats Move From Moore To Trump
434.plot: A pipe bomber in New York City fails. CNN's attempt to implicate Trump in Russian collusion also fails. Democrats hope to get to Trump through Roy Moore. Ben Shapiro recommends the hilariously bad drama, The Room (2003).

435.title: Jimmy Kimmel Weaponizes His Baby... Again
435.plot: Jimmy Kimmel uses his baby as a political prop. Roy Moore rides a horse to the voting booth. Everyday Feminism has questions for intersectional feminists to ask on a first date.

436.title: The Tide Rolls Over Roy Moore
436.plot: Democrat Doug Jones beats Roy Moore in the U.S. Senate race in Alabama. Peter Strzok's private text calls Robert Mueller's investigation into question. Barbie dolls get political.

437.title: Will Sexual Allegations Cross a Line?
437.plot: A GOP state representative in Kentucky commits suicide after sexual assault allegations. Morgan Spurlock confesses to sexual impropriety. Zoe Heller writes "In Defense of Adultery" for the New Yorker.

438.title: Is It the End of the Internet?
438.plot: The Left freaks out when Net Neutrality is repealed. Donald Trump celebrates deregulation with a red-tape-cutting ceremony.

439.title: Is Trump Finally Winning?
439.plot: Ben looks at the latest on the Robert Mueller investigation, the mainstream media vs. Trump, the Federalist Papers no. 8, the new Star Wars movie, and more.

440.title: Trump's Big Tax Day
440.plot: Trump's tax bill is about to pass, and the media is outraged. Ben details the good and bad things Trump has done his first year. #MeToo sees a backlash.

441.title: Everyone Just Died... Again
441.plot: Trump's tax cut passes Congress, everyone dies, and Ben Shapiro wanders the Earth alone.

442.title: A Big Leftist Myth Implodes on Taxes
442.plot: Ben learns that Nikki Haley is his spirit animal. Rep. Ted Lieu wants human jealousy to determine policy. Hollywood gets around to making a movie about the Chappaquiddick incident.

443.title: Say Goodbye to 2017
443.plot: Ben reaffirms that Nikki Haley is his spirit animal. Mailbag topics include: supply-side economics, homeschooling, Trump on Twitter, Rosie O'Donnell on Twitter, Zionism, and more.

444.title: It's a Brand New Year!

446.title: Trump Destroys Bannon, Salts the Earth
446.plot: President Trump eviscerates Steve Bannon, and Ben couldn't be happier.

447.title: The Feds Target Weed
447.plot: Trump awards the nickname of "Sloppy Steve" to Steve Bannon. Ben doubts Michael Wolff's book will tear down the president.

448.title: Oprah for President?
448.plot: Oprah Winfrey's lauded speech at the Golden Globes leads to talk of her running for President. Donald Trump declares that he is a "very stable genius". Ben tackles The Federalist Paper No. 10 by James Madison.

449.title: Trump's America
449.plot: The Left accuses Donald Trump of not knowing the words to the National Anthem. Ben recommends The Sessions (2012).

455.title: Weeping Toward Victory

456.title: The Fake News Awards
456.plot: Donald Trump's Fake New Awards prove disappointing. Vibrator art is now a thing.

457.title: The Fusion GPS Scandal
457.plot: The Fusion GPS scandal heats up. The Democrats prepare to shut down the government. Mailbag topics include Ben's favorite book to write, what kosher is, and more.

458.title: Shutdown Showdown
458.plot: The government shutdown may be over. Trump may have a good excuse to shut down the Robert Mueller investigation. Hollywood attacks Melania.

460.title: The Imploding Russia Probe

469.title: The Bear Market Arrives

470.title: Who's Endangering the Republic?
470.plot: Ben discusses the latest in the FBI texting scandal, Donald Trump's proposed military parade, Democrats filibustering for another government shutdown, and more.

471.title: A Black Eye for the Trump Administration
471.plot: White House Staff Secretary Rob Porter gives the Trump administration a black eye. Republicans make a bad budget deal. Nancy Pelosi filibusters. Sports Illustrated joins the #MeToo movement.

472.title: Corruption, Chaos, and Cretinism
472.plot: Ben discusses the Rob Porter scandal, the Republican's budget compromise, Memogate, and more.

473.title: The Media Love Them Some North Korea

474.title: Making Wakanda Great Again

imdb.plot outline: Big daddy Shapiro spews words of truth and knowledge as he covers political issues and current events. He will not - dare we say, cannot - be stopped. Out with the feelings, and in with the facts, because this thug suffers no fools, cowards or charlatans.
imdb.title: The Ben Shapiro Show
plot: Big daddy Shapiro spews words of truth and knowledge as he covers political issues and current events. He will not - dare we say, cannot - be stopped. Out with the feelings, and in with the facts, because this thug suffers no fools, cowards or charlatans.
